Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient feels okay and expressed relief after writing a letter to their dad, which facilitated communication between them.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient felt liberated after expressing their thoughts in the letter, leading to a deeper conversation with their dad about feelings and fears. They reported feeling lighter and more at peace regarding their anxiety about their dad's health.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been leaning on supportive friends, which has strengthened their connections.
Physiological Observations: The patient has been practicing muscle relaxation techniques before bed, which has improved their sleep quality. They have experienced fewer stress dreams.
Current Functional Status: The patient maintains a routine to manage audition-related stress and employs breathing exercises to calm nerves before auditions.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress in managing anxiety and is more open in their relationships.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is focusing on relaxation techniques and breathing exercises as part of their therapeutic approach.
Next Steps: The patient aims to explore dramatic acting roles and plans to take a class focused on this in the next month while continuing to work on relaxation techniques.
